name: Richard CARTER, for the Incarcerated Citizens' Congress, Petitioner, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Respondents

parties: Richard CARTER, for the Incarcerated Citizens’ Congress, Petitioner, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Respondents.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 20th day of August, 1997, the petition for allowance of appeal is dismissed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
697 A.2d 588
Richard CARTER, for the Incarcerated Citizens’ Congress, Petitioner, v. Tom RIDGE, Governor of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, Stewart J. Greenleaf, Senator/Chairman of the Pennsylvania Senate Judiciary Committee, and Michael R. Hackman, Associate Director of the Pennsylvania Prison Society, Respondents.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Aug. 20, 1997.
